result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Hancock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction mailed to defendant at 403 Jackson Street, Portage, WI 53901 was returned marked "return to sender, attempted, not known"
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel

1:14 P.M., Defendant Michael A Hancock in court, in custody appearing telephonically from the Hazelton, Federal Correctional Institution in West Virginia, with attorney Mark David Lawton personally present.  Cliff Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 1, 9 months jail, concurrent to any other sentence, $443.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, Ct. 2, 90 days jail, consecutive to Ct. 1, concurrent to any other sentence, $243.00 costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, defendant to submit DNA Sample, 1:24 P.M.
Notice of October 14 plea/sentence sent to defendant at Columbia County Jail returned - released
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Amended Information filed by Atty Burdon
Notice of November 10 jury trial sent to defendant at Columbia County Jail, returned not incarcerated.  Counsel to contact him.
scheduling order
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

11:14 A.M., Attorney Mark D. Lawton appeared. Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lawton states defendant is in federal prison in West Virginia and was unable to set up phone conference, Atty Lawton states defendant is not requesting a speedy trial, matter to be set for status conference in six months 11:16 A.M.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-30-2015 11:00 am
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Columbia County Jail/USMS for 8/27/15 at 9:00 A.M.
Discovery letter filed.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List filed by ADA Yaskal
scheduling order
Jury trial at 08-27-2015 09:00 am
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey

Defendant Michael A Hancock in court, in custody with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State called witness (Deputy D. Clark).  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Closing statements.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant pled not guilty to both counts. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.  20 days to file motions.
Atty. Mark Lawton appointed
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Columbia County Jail for 6/11/15 at 9:00 am
with felony conds.

Defendant, Michael A Hancock, appeared by jail video with Attorney Leonie Dolch, special for the public defender office. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $1,000 recog. bond with felony conds. Time limits not waived. DNA sample to be taken. Right to expunge sample recited. Demand for Speedy Trial made - to be done in writing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for Columbia County Jail on 6/4/15 at 2:00 P.M.
